nodes.text: Jundland Station was a settlement on Tatooine located near Mos Osnoe, Boorka's Palace, and the Confederacy way station. It was either located at the Jundland Wastes on Tatooine, or was otherwise named after it. The Jundland Station included housing, speeders, a downed starship, and a B'omarr Monastery.

During the Second Battle of Tatooine, Jundland Station was visited by Jedi General Echuu Shen-Jon and Padawan Naat Reath after their meeting with Jabba the Hutt, concerning the alliance between Boorka and the Separatists. The citizens of Jundland Station asked Echuu and his clone trooper forces to destroy the Tusken Raiders that have been harrassing the settlement. Aggreeing to help them, Echuu and his troops wiped out the nearby Tusken village, destroying all of their tents and killing all men, women, and children. In their gratitude, the villagers have rewarded the Republic forces with resources and Kaminoan droids, allowing the Republic to set up a base and prepare for the battle against Boorka and Confederacy's forces.

The Jundland Station was a location in Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds and its expansion pack, Clone Campaigns. It is encountered in the third Galactic Republic campaign mission, "Never Trust a Hutt". Although technically a side quest, the Jundland Station's request to destroy the Tuskens must be completed to get the necessary resources to create enough forces to win the mission without the use of cheat codes. To complete the side quest the player is required to either wipe out or turn every man, woman, and child in the Tusken village to the east of Jundland Station, and also destroy their buildings. As such, it may be presumed that the whole Tusken settlement was wiped out by Echuu's forces.

The other version of the "Jundland Station" was accessible via a bonus mission in the Liberation of Kashyyyk mission of the Wookiee Campaign. Because of this as well as the presence of Tusken Raiders and a desert environment, it was left ambiguous as to whether the location was at Kashyyyk or at Tatooine.
In this version, Jundland Station was a Tusken Raider camp. It was either located at the Jundland Wastes on Tatooine, or was otherwise named after it.

Naboo Queen Padmé Amidala was held prisoner by the Tusken Raiders after they had somehow captured her when she landed in close proximity. Jedi Knights Obi-Wan Kenobi and Qui-Gon Jinn, alongside an Ewok mercenary named Simon, staged a rescue of Amidala, successfully doing so before she was beaten to death by her captors.

While escorting the Queen back to the J-type 327 Nubian royal starship, also killing the bounty hunter Aurra Sing when she attempted to stop them, the trio ended up ambushed by Darth Maul, but they successfully vanquished him.

The location, like the mission it appeared in, is likewise assumed to be non-canon until stated otherwise, due to the presence of characters long dead by 4 ABY (the date of the Liberation of Kashyyyk according to The Essential Atlas and Galactic Battlegrounds) such as Padmé Amidala, Obi-Wan Kenobi, and Qui-Gon Jinn.
